newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Stop German subsidies, European glass makers say.
newsitem.headline: Stop German subsidies, European glass makers say.

text.p: European glass producers asked the European Commission on Wednesday to intervene on subsidies paid to east German rivals arguing that the sector was already suffering from over-capacity.

"At a time when the flat glass industry in Europe is facing severe over-capacity, it is unreasonnable that new green field projects should receive huge subsidies," the chairman of a adjustments European grouping of flat glass producers (GEPVP), Alan Havard, said in a statement.

The protest was triggered by an investment by Troesch Glas Holding AG near Magdeburg, in Saxon, an industry source said. Another project by Guardian Industries Corporation of the United States was also the subject of complaints.

This is another blow for the German government, whose policy of channeling huge subsidies to the former east German has been seriously contested by rival companies in other EU countries particularly in the shipbuilding industry.
GEPVP had no figures on total aid paid to German projects in the flat glass sector.
